result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin L Carson was found guilty of Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Kevin L Carson was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Kevin L Carson was found guilty of Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin L Carson in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Kevin L Carson in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by the victim, Robert J., III

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 15 YEARS, concurrent to Count #4 and Count #6, concurrent to case# 13CF5555, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 10 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS, concurrent to Count #1 and Count #6, concurrent to case# 13CF5555, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.
Credit for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 6:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS, concurrent to Count #1 and Count #4, concurrent to case# 13CF5555, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.    
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1, 4, & 6):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY fine in the amount of $600.00 (as to Count #4).  The Court ordered that the fine be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 2 years (as to Count #4).
* Court ordered defendant's driver operating privileges REVOKED for a period of 2 years (as to Count #1 and Count #4).
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
* No driving without a valid driver's license.

  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

filed by ADA Catelin Ringersma on behalf of the State.  Count #4 is AMENDED to:  Operating While Intoxicated - 5th or 6th Offense [a Class H FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 346.63(1)(a), 939.50(3)(h).

Defendant Kevin L Carson in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Kevin L Carson in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #4 AMENDED to:  Operating While Intoxicated - 5th or 6th Offense [a Class H FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 346.63(1)(a), 939.50(3)(h).

AS TO COUNTS 1, 4 (AMENDED), & 6:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

**Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #s 2, 3, & 5 dismissed outright.

Case adjourned to 06-17-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Kevin L Carson in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Kevin L Carson in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court on defense motion to suppress evidence AND State's Daubert motion.

Defense waived reading of the Amended Information and pled not guilty to Count #4.

AS TO DEFENSE MOTION TO SUPPRESS EVIDENCE:  Sworn and testified as a witness for the State:  Officer Kirk Will.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments.  Court DENIED defense motion to suppress evidence.

AS TO STATE'S DAUBERT MOTION:  Sworn and testified as a witness for the State:  Crime Lab Technician, Leah M.  Testimony closed.  Court entered and received Closing arguments.  Court finds that Leah M. is qualified as an expert witness.  Court GRANTED State's Daubert motion. 

Defendant now wishes to enter a plea.
Court proceeds with a Plea Hearing......

Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
